intro: Stigmaphyllon periplocifolium, commonly known as the velvetleaf stigmaphyllon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
